text: hello my name is Shaun Baker and I'm the
director of the Florida project we're
about twenty minutes into the film here
and little Mooney is giving a tour the
budget motel that she lives at to the
new girl Chauncey and of course they are
getting into trouble within minutes and
they decide to enter a room that results
in this this is willem dafoe
playing the character of Bobby the motel
manager although this looks like a
simple shot was actually one of the more
choreographed shots of the entire film
we had a number of extras played by
actual Motel residents in the area and
they were basically waiting for their
cues to exit here and as you can see we
we spaced them out so that everybody
wouldn't be exiting abruptly from the
doors at the same time but there would
be a steady reveal of the residents and
I think this is the moment in the film
where we actually do show that there's
life behind all of these doors and that
this this is actually a knock a very
occupied motel and then of course here
is Willem turning the power back on we
had our wonderful art department build
that little lever there so my wonderful
cinematographer alexis sabe truly knows
how to shoot the skies clouds sunsets
and this is a great example of it we had
a Steadicam here my Steadicam artist
Aziz so Vera there's this really nice
tracking shot that I think really gives
Willem and the character of Bobby a lot
of power here by looking up at Bobby it
makes him triumphant for a moment
